Title: Asst. Manager, HR Business Partner - Fortune 500 MNC
Summary: Newly Created HRBP role. Excellent Opportunity to Drive Change and Make a Difference.
Details:
Summary

Our client is a leading multinational in the commodities manufacturing industry with a strong global footprint and a significant asset base within this region. They are currently going through a HR transformation to put in place a HR Business Partnering team to help drive the business objectives.
 
Responsibilities

This is a newly created role and your mandate will be to align HR programs with business strategy, working closely with the business to facilitate change management and develop HR initiatives to address business needs & objectives. You will be responsible for engaging with the business managers as well as the wider HR team (shared services and COEs) in order to develop and implement HR programs effectively. This is an excellent opportunity to be a change agent in the organization, value add and make an impact.

Requirements

You are degree qualified with 6 – 10 years of experience as a HR Generalist / Business Partner, ideally with some experience in the manufacturing industry. You should be able to build strong relationships with senior stakeholders, keen to drive change and manage projects. The ideal candidate is a team player with a positive can-do attitude, able to work independently.
Interested Applicants

Kindly submit your application online using the Profile Search & Selection website, which can be accessed via the “Apply Now” link below.

Please search for this position under our Human Resource practice area, the Job Reference Number is AS12941.

Title: HR Business Partner - FMCG
Summary: Opportunity to contribute to the people strategy in a reputable organisation with a diverse & progressive work culture
Details:
Summary

Our client is an established name within the FMCG industry, with a diverse portfolio of market-leading products. Recognised as a forward-thinking organization with a strong employee-centric culture, a need has arisen to recruit an additional HR business partner into the existing team.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Head of HR for the country, this role will be responsible for the provision of HR advice and support to a large internal client group. You will be heavily involved in working with line management on ensuring the necessary HR infrastructure and strategy to meet business objectives. Areas you will responsible for include recruitment and retention, annual C&B processes, employee and union relations, as well as project work.

Requirements

The successful candidate with have a strong academic track record and at least 7 years of experience gained within large multinational corporations, preferably from the FMCG industry. You will be a broad generalist - strengths in recruitment, employee relations and projects will be advantageous. You will be a driven and committed individual who is passionate about HR and enjoys multi-tasking. You must also demonstrate being able to work autonomously with minimal supervision.

Singapore work experience is required for this role.

Summary: Full spectrum HR
Details:
• Exciting career opportunity
  • Established MNC
  • Leading a team
 
Our client is a reputed MNC that delivers diverse products, services and solutions to increase energy efficiency for buildings.  They are looking for a HR Manager to join their team as a strategic business partner.
 
This role will cover full spectrum of HR services and EHS function. You will be a point of contact for HR related matters. To be successful in the position you will have a bachelor degree with 10 years of full spectrum HR experience. Good communication skills with proven leadership qualities will make you suitable for the position.

Title: HRIS Analyst
CompanyName: Elliott Scott HR Recruitment Pte Ltd
Summary: Singapore, Commodities
Details:
Great opportunity for an experienced HRIS Analyst to join a world class commodities company. With an excellent global presence within the industry, this multinational is now looking for a confident and meticulous candidate to join their team.

  • Foreign MNC
  • Working within a friendly international environment
  • Travel opportunities

As a HRIS Analyst, you serve as a subject matter expert of Workday and will be responsible for the electronic migration of data and maintenance of the HR database for all staff movement. You will ensure regular audit across the Asia region and provide training for new and existing users on the systems and tools. You will test and evaluate the overall system performance and analyze software releases. You will provide ad-hoc HR reports as well. Due to the expansion of the company in the region, you should be comfortable to travel on an ad-hoc basis around the region to provide HRIS training for various users. You will provide excellent communication and technical advices to all new and existing HR partners.

We require a candidate who has strong proven experience managing HRIS systems, either in a HR function or in a technical function supporting HR. You will have a solid foundation of HRIS design, structure, functions and processes with a good knowledge of HR practices. You will have an excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, as well as the ability to work in a fast pace and collaborative environment. You are exceptionally strong in data management, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent communications and presentation skills are essential, while having patience as one of your winning personal traits. In addition we are also looking for:

  • HRIS analyst background with minimum five years experience
  • Workday experience strongly preferred
  • Independent worker as well as a good team player in an ambiguous environment

Title: Total Rewards Analyst SEA
Summary: A Fortune 500 company and a market leader to provide global services and solutions has an opening for a Total Rewards Analyst, South East Asia.
Details:
We represent a Fortune 500 company and a market leader known to provide global services and solutions that are delivered locally by experienced and professional teams. Based at the regional head office, we now have an opening for a Total Rewards Analyst, South East Asia to join this winning team.
 
You will be responsible for the delivery and maintenance of broad-based salary administration programs to ensure equitable and competitive practices for Southeast Asia. Working under general supervision, the Total Rewards Analyst will apply knowledge of compensation concepts, policies, practices and procedures to perform to complex elements of a variety of compensation functions and serve as an internal consultant for job classification, salary administration, merit, equity and compensation policy and procedures issues. In addition, you may oversee various country benefit programs. The incumbent will build relationships with the Total Rewards COE and leadership team to partner with field HR to delivery consistent and timely services.
In this newly created position, you will be responsible for South East Asia Total Rewards operations activities such as performance based increment, annual salary plan, local incentive plan, sales commission/incentive, equity and benefits. You will also be responsible for reviewing off-cycle adjustment and package outside of guidelines including working with Total Rewards COE on exception cases.
As part of the Asia Pacific Total Rewards Operations team, you will be team liaison with the other Total Rewards Operation teams to design and develop broad-based compensation operational processes and controls for implementation, forecasting and reporting of programs for the organisation.
Other responsibilities include:
  • Administration of South East Asia benefit programs
  • Administration of mobility local activities for international assignees based in South East Asia
  • Partner Total Rewards COE in compensation or benefit market surveys and analysis
  • Develop techniques for compiling, preparing and presenting data to demonstrate metrics of success
Overall, maintain expertise in compensation and benefits and keep informed of developments and trends and incorporate appropriate operational changes to provide better customer service in these programs.
 
To be successful in this role, you will require:
  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • 5 years or more in progressive compensation experience, HR systems and understanding of six sigma process
  • In-depth knowledge of broad-based compensation programs (merit, equity, bonus programs) and current compensation processes
  • In-depth knowledge of South East Asia country benefit programs
  • Strong customer commitment to accurate and timely service
  • Analytic creativity and problem solving skills
 Our client has a strong focus on core values, encouraging innovation and a positive attitude to the opportunities afforded by change as port of a growing organisation. You will be assessed on your skills in providing creative human resources solutions, and in turn, you will be part of a team that values open communication and is supportive of each other.
 
Please submit your application with your full CV and include your motivation factors for your next career move. For any enquiries, please write to hr@dnassociates.com.sg quoting Reference No. 00125.
We thank you for your interest in this application and regret that only short-listed candidates are notified.

Title: Senior HR Manager
Summary: Exciting setup role in a well-reputed and award-winning organisation going through rapid growth
Details:
Summary

Our client is a well-respected and award-winning brand name in the hospitality industry. With an expanding presence across the US, Europe and South-East Asia, a prime opportunity exists for a top-tier Human Resources professional to join them as part of their senior management team.

Responsibilities

Reporting directly to the Managing Director, this exciting position will work closely with the senior management team to develop the organisation's human capital strategies across its operations. This green field role will involve building up the Human Resources function by enhancing talent acquisition practices, developing corporate policies, building the employer branding and culture, as well as providing leadership to the HR teams across the various regions.

Requirements

You will be a senior HR professional with at least 10 years of experience, of which 3 years should be at senior management level within the hospitality or service industry. Previous regional experience is essential, especially with regards to South-East Asia, and international exposure to Europe & the US will be a definite plus. You will be entrepreneurial and enjoy the potential to grow an organization. In addition, you must have a 'hands-on' and results driven approach, a strong leadership style and an ability to drive change.

HR & Admin Manager

You will develop, implement and deliver hi-potential and management training programmes for the Asia Pacific region.  You will work with business leaders and managers to identify learning needs and design in-house solution which includes a blended approach to learning such as classroom training, coaching, 1 to 1 sessions, action learning, etc.  You will deliver these blended solutions and learning sessions to your delegates.  You will also collaborate with programmes planner, assist in programmes facilitation, optimise all learning opportunities and measure its effectiveness.

Title: Human Resources and Recruiting Manager
Summary: Financial Services Industry, Dynamic and Challenging Environment, A Rewarding Individual Contributor Role
Details:
A respectable industry player with exciting growth plans, our client seeks a dynamic Human Resources and Recruiting Manager to join and play an integral role in its Singapore operations.
 
Partnering Managing Director and senior management, you will perform the role of an advisor to identify and address overall HR needs.  You will be responsible for employee life cycle and hiring strategies, managing the end-to-end recruitment process for experienced as well as graduate hires.  You will support and assist managers in developing their employees through organization development initiatives and plans, from learning & development to career planning for hi-potentials.  You will also manage the payroll process including reporting and tax related matters.  You will coordinate benefit programmes and ensure its market competitiveness.  As a HR representative and part of a lean global team, you will provide coverage for counterpart as and when required.
 
The successful candidate has minimum 6 years of HR and Recruiting experience in similar industry.  You must have direct experience in developing and executing talent acquisition strategies for attracting, retaining and developing top talents, experienced and senior management hires.  You have exposure to payroll management, compensation & benefits management, on-boarding and off-boarding processes, employee relations and performance management, global mobility, working with international teams and knowledge of local labour legislations.  As an individual contributor, you are able to multitask and prioritise, are highly hands-on, with a can-do attitude and willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done.  Strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills in addition to excellent communication skill are key success factors.

Title: Compensation & Benefits Specialist
Summary: Great opportunity to join a global organisation as a C&B Specialist
Details:
This is an established manufacturing company with a strong global footprint. There is now an excellent opportunity to join the organization as a Compensation & Benefits specialist. Reporting into the Senior C&B Manager, you will work as an advisor to business units and regional HR managers. You will analyze the job markets, benchmark job positions and align current benefits with the market data, align job grades with the various Business Segments.

Title: HR Manager
Summary: Our client is a US-listed company is currently seeking a HR Manager to become a member of the country team
Details:
Our client is a US-listed company with significant market share and an enviable reputation within their areas of specialisation. They pride themselves with unrivaled product knowledge, offering their clients the most comprehensive and best service portfolio in the industry. With their consistent growth across the region, they are presently seeking a HR Manager to become a member of the country team. 
Reporting to the Country Manager and dotted line into the Regional HR Manager, the primary accountability of this position is to support all staff on matters pertaining to HR. The role requires understanding of HR policies pertaining to hiring, benefits, taxation, as well as the ability to work seamlessly with payroll, benefits, tax and other vendors in deploying and managing these matters on a regular basis. Your daily responsibilities include:
 
  • Managing entire recruitment process including job posting, candidate screening, vetting and interview
  • Applying and renewing the working passes for the new incumbents and existing employees
  • Provide support on retaining and engaging quality staff
  • Assisting to drive the culture change campaign and other related activities
  • Ensuring that employee database is updated and accurate
  • Identifying the development needs of the employee and arrange for training either through internal or external resources
  • Implementing the new performance review and establish the individual development plan for high potential staff
  • Involvement in the annual salary review and bonus process
  • Preparing the annually staff cost budget and forecasting
  • Preparing the monthly payroll, CPF contribution and income tax reporting
  • Reviewing and renewing staff’s benefits and insurance policies
  • Leading procurement and administration functions
  • Involve in other ad hoc HR projects initiated by the Country Manager
 
Requirements
  • Diploma or Bachelor degree holder specialized in Human Resources or Business Administration
  • At least 6 years’ working experience in HR function, with minimum 2 years supervisory experiences
  • Experienced recruitment on frontline staff in Malaysia preferred
  • Well-versed in local Employment Act, Work Passes application and other government legislation
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and able to deal with different level of staff 
  • Strong sense of responsibility and self-motivated with positive working attitude
  • Meticulous and well organized
  • Strong problem solving and influencing skills
  • Excellent verbal presentation and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications
 
This position interacts with varying levels of personnel and you will have the ability to influence senior management on your decisions. Paired with a competitive salary and benefits package, you will benefit from a new and challenging position playing a crucial part in this company’s ongoing success, at the forefront of the industry.
 
Please submit your application with your full CV and include your motivation factors for your next career move. For any enquiries, please write to hr@dnassociates.com.sg quoting Reference No. 00093.

A multinational business centrally located in Singapore own a number of business lines across Asia. They are looking for a Head of Organisational Development and Change to play a significant role in driving the cultural transformation of this large scale business.

You will be responsible in identifying and understanding the current culture and putting in place programs and initiatives to encourage and change the business mindset and shape behaviour towards the desired culture and values acting as an internal consultant.

You will serve as a subject matter expert and there will be a focus to lead the design, develop and implement programs, policies and strategies to shape mindset and behaviour towards culture and values. From this you will identify the key underlying issues to adjust and recommend new programs, policies and processes and develop metrics to monitor success whilst constantly discovering new ways to enhance and develop a desired culture and values.

Title: International HR Board Member
Summary: Member of MAF International Board with experience and expertise in are of Human Resources
Details:
International HR Board Member - Could this be you?

MAF's purpose is to share God's love through aviation and techonolgy. Motivated by our Christian faith and God's love and concern for all people, MAF's vision is to see isolated people physically and spiritually transformed in Christ's name.

MAF International is governed by a skills-based Board of Trustees.

Currently we are experiencing unprecedented levels of change and some of the major challenges for the future centre around the 'people' agenda. With a global industry-wide skills shortage in aviation, attracting and retaining talent is becoming increasingly difficult in a Christian mission context. Increasing requirements for crisis response in volatile environments with attendant responsibilities regarding duty of care, together with more and more complex models of reward and remuneration, has led to a greater requirement for specialist human resources input.

In response to this dynamic changing context, we are reviewing some of our core policies and processes including international staff remuneration, developing new pilot/engineer routes, blended learning approaches (utilising technology). We also continue to review our operational ministry models and want to become better prepared to work with a greater diversification of cultures.

Therefore the MAF International Board have decided to look for an additional HR trustee. Please apply if you are a senior HR professional who would like to volunteer to support this worthwhile organisation and meet the following specifications:
  • International (developing country) HR experience at senior level
  • Committed and mature evangelical Christian
  • Willing and able to travel to three Global Board meetings each year (15-20 days per year)
  • A stretagic thinker who understands governance and HR's contribution to the whole organisation
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English
  • Ability to work in a team
  • Able to work with team members to resolve conflicts both face-to-face and remotely
Please apply to Wendy Kneller, HR Director (wendy.kneller@maf.org)

For further information about MAF see www.maf-uk.org

Title: Regional HR Project Manager
Summary: At this US-listed multinational, the HR team wears many hats supporting offices around the region is seeking a Regional C&B and HR Analytics Manager
Details:
Supporting the growth of an international company is no easy feat - it demands diplomacy, business acumen, and the ability to execute upon strategy that scales for a leading organization. At this US-listed multinational, the HR team wears many hats supporting offices around the region. We are now seeking a multi-faceted Regional HR Project Manager with experience working within Asia Pacific markets to support the team’s growth in China, India, Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia and Singapore. In this newly created position, this talented individual will be responsible for creating, implementing, evolving, and executing the Human Resources agenda for Asia Pacific.
 Working together with the Regional HR Director and Regional HR Business Partner, yours is a critical role that will help shape our client’s HR capability by improving efficiencies. At a regional level, you will be responsible for identifying areas to optimise the HR system. This will require you to successfully multi-task between various roles as project manager, project lead, test lead, functional consultant and business analyst.
 
As part of the Global HR Transformation, the upcoming HR projects in the pipeline include system efficiency studies for global payroll, performance management, talent management and talent attraction. You will also be a key driver in employee data analysis driven projects ranging from design, development and roll-out of 360 degree feedback.
   
To be successful in this role, you will possess the following experience, knowledge and skills:
  • Minimum of 8 years working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines and project management experience.
  • Analytic creativity and problem solving skills.
  • Excellent client management and business literacy skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Develop strong trusting relationships in order to gain support and achieve results.
  • Ability to understand issues domestically and regionally and communicate effectively with internal clients.
  • Be flexible and available to interact with employees at all levels.
  • Be self-directed and motivated.
  • Take initiative to identify and anticipate client needs and make recommendations for implementation.

Working with a range of stakeholders, you will add genuine insight to the business and will develop a holistic understanding of the business, with many opportunities to demonstrate your talent and drive. You will find yourself working in a high energy, fast-paced and exciting environment. With a competitive salary and benefits package, you will benefit from a new and challenging position playing a crucial part in this company’s success story.
 
 
Please submit your application with your full CV and include your motivation factors for your next career move. For any enquiries, please write to hr@dnassociates.com.sg quoting Reference No. 00130.

Title: HRIS Analyst
Summary: Our client is one of the leading global multi-specialty healthcare companies and is looking for a HRIS Analyst.
Details:
Our client is one of the leading global multi-specialty healthcare companies that is focused on discovering, developing and commercialising innovative pharmaceuticals, biologics and medical devices that enable people to live life to its greatest potential. Their innovative products and market leadership positions are driven by people with a passion for making a difference. Our client has experienced phenomenal growth over recent years and they continue to grow and expand steadily. We now have a position as a HRIS Analyst open.
 
Reporting to the Director, Talent Acquisition and HRIS Asia Pacific, the HRIS Analyst supports my client’s mission to attract, motivate, develop and retain exceptional talent for today and for the future by effectively leveraging technology and systems to drive operational excellence, enable informed business decisions, and create an exceptional employee experience.
The successful individual for this role is a human resources professional who has an intuitive understanding of technology and enjoys analyzing data in order to discover meaningful insights for the business. They will have a keen eye for detail and accuracy and will interact and partner well with multiple levels across the Human Resources function to ensure that the systems are being utilized to their fullest advantage. There is also an education component to this role, and they will act as coach and expert support to other HR team members to continuously lift the expertise of HRIS users across the Asia Pacific region.
 
This role is hands-on with involvement in day to day activities as follows:
  • Supporting the effective utilisation of human resource information systems. The primary focus will be on the core SAP database, but will also include Success Factors (performance management), Taleo (talent acquisition), LMS (learning and development)
  • Facilitating the monthly team meetings (comprising of HR Specialists from around the Asia Pacific region), providing continuous education and a strong focus on data integrity
  • Delivering systems training to new SAP team members and HR Specialists and Managers
  • Leading the reporting and analytics for all HRIS, generating key reports such as Monthly Headcount Reports and the Quarterly Talent Dashboard for the region
  • Reviewing reports for accuracy and providing relevant talent insights for senior leaders
  • Auditing HRIS data following the completion of core business processes (Objective Setting, Development Planning, Annual Review, Promotions, etc) in line with KPIs to report results and highlight opportunities for improvement
  • Supporting the design and creation of an enhanced Asia Pacific country-based portal communication site
  • Reviewing all Asia Pacific portal sites and develop recommendations for enhancements
  • Testing of new HRIS functionality in line with strategic changes and enhancements to processes and systems
  • Working closely with the Director TA / HRIS to recommend and implement enhancements to our existing systems, reports, and processes
     
     
    Requirements
  • Successful completion of tertiary qualifications in business, communications, human resources or related discipline and/or equivalent work experience: Ideally a minimum of 6 years of related business experience and ideally at least 3 years of data analytics experience within the HR function.
  • Expert knowledge of SAP HR is essential (Org Management, Personnel Administration, and Ad Hoc Query)
  • Good working knowledge of other human resource information systems including: Success Factors, Taleo, Plateau and/or other recruiting, performance management, learning management systems is preferred
  • Proven experience in data analytics
  • Proven experience in designing meaningful reports and confidence with numerical calculations
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively
  • Experience working collaboratively and cross-functionally in a matrixed structure, supporting multiple stakeholders
  • Strong skills in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.
  • The successful incumbent must be able to demonstrate that he/she is a responsible and proactive self-starter requiring minimal supervision
 
This role places you in a position of influence where you will have direct access to business units and feel the pulse of the organisation. Engaging deeply with the line, you will facilitate line discussions by providing HR perspectives and sound guidance on people challenges. You will proactively share HR intelligence and insights with the objective of inculcating a talent mindset, promoting a high performance culture and building a healthy succession pipe. You will also shape and drive organisation-wide HR initiatives in the areas employee engagement through understanding officers’ motivations, and establishing strategies and platforms to foster organisational commitment, as part of the overall employee value proposition.
 
 
Please submit your application with your full CV and include your motivation factors for your next career move. For any enquiries, please write to hr@dnassociates.com.sg quoting Reference No. 00142.
 
We thank you for your interest in this application and regret that only short-listed candidates are notified.

  • HR policies, guidelines, approval processes and frameworks: support the crafting and alignment of HR policies, guidelines, approval processes, frameworks and manage the compliance including exceptions
  • HR audits: serve as the main point of contact for audits
  • Industrial relations: manage the risk assessments and coordinate cross-divisional approach to industrial relations
  • HR budgets: manage the region’s HR budget alignment including preparation and ensuring transparency of HR costs, labour costs and productivity
  • Workforce demand and planning: collation of country reporting; responsible for the region’s workforce planning tool

Relevant work experience across multiple Southeast Asia countries is required, as with a degree in Human Resources and/or a numerical subject (eg. Statistics, Finance, Engineering etc). Excellent communication, interpersonal and influencing skills will be critical to your success.
 
You will deliver leading-edge HR tools, processes, expertise and metrics which enable the organisation to shape, execute and align the business and people strategy, build their talent and enhance the performance culture. Title: Senior HR  Manager - Employee Engagement & HR Programs (Global MNC)
Summary: Lead and drive the HR performance within the South Asia and South East Asia region.
Details:
A new and unique opportunity has arisen within this global brand and market leader, for a Senior HR professional to look after a number of operational aspects and projects within the HR function.
 
Reporting into the Asia Pacific HR Vice President, this newly created role will focus on Singapore and South East Asia, focussing on KPI reporting, dealing with HR policies, guidelines and frameworks, and managing HR projects and programs.
 
At a senior level, you will be leading HR performance by KPI metrics, working with and managing relationships within HR shared services providers, rolling out HRIS systems and managing the HR project portfolio.
 
With a university degree, you will come from a fast paced MNC background, where you have been involved in HR reporting, HR IT, policies, change management, business partnering and employee programs. Your strong stakeholder management will be highly important as will you ability with numbers and analysis.
 
If you think you have the right experience for this role, then please contact Ash Russell (R1109296) on +65 63030721 or email ash.russell@hays.com.sg.

Title: Talent Acquisition & Management - Premier US Organization
Summary: Seeking Talent Acquisition Professional who can be hands-on while contributing from a strategic perspective. Newly created role!
Details:
Summary

Our client is a world renowned, premier organisation in the hospitality industry. A dynamic organization, known for investing in their people and provide career development opportunities. They are currently looking for a Talent Acquisition professional to lead the function.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the HR Director, this is an individual contributor role supporting the Singapore, Hong Kong and Regional Office, recruiting for corporate functions, while also contributing on a strategic level. You will be working very closely with business leaders to develop and execute hiring strategies to contribute towards business objectives. You will be responsible for developing recruitment strategies & programs, workforce planning, careers management and looking at policies and processes. The ideal candidate is someone who can be hands-on in an individual contributor role, yet able to see the big picture and engage & influence senior leaders.

Requirements

You must be degree qualified, with at least 7 years experience in HR, with 1-3yrs of leading & managing recruitment/staffing. You should have proven ability to deliver talent acquisition services in a fast-paced environment, and demonstrated capabilities to engage at the senior management level. Strong communication skills are required to work effectively across the business functions and levels.  Above all you must be highly motivated, professional and have a customer focused and matured approach.

Interested Applicants

Kindly submit your application online using the Profile Search & Selection website, which can be accessed via the “Apply Now” link below.

Please search for this position under our Human Resource practice area, the Job Reference Number is AS13204.

We will treat your interest in this role with the strictest of confidence.

Title: C&B Analyst
CompanyName: Elliott Scott HR Recruitment Pte Ltd
Summary: Singapore, Professional Services
Details:
Excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic and proactive candidate to join a market leading professional services industry. We are now looking for an independent candidate with a motivated mindset, to provide dedicated compensation & benefits support to the APAC region.

·         Dynamic and diverse working environment
·         Market leading MNC
·         Regional role with strong career prospects

As a C&B analyst, you will be supporting the Head of Compensation & Benefit and perform the full spectrum of C&B work. While coordinating the annual compensation cycle for APAC, you will be supporting on the budget cycle and quarterly funding exercise. You will be providing headcount and compensation analysis reports and participate in external remunerations surveys. You will be involved in streamlining the current compensation process, as well as reviewing incentive schemes such as commission plans and profit share. Adding on, you will be supporting the local HR on C&B matters as well with the ability to deal with tight deadlines.

The ideal candidate will possess a good understanding of compensation and incentive practice, accounting & finance degree or finance trained experience, plus the ability to engage stakeholders across the business. You will be comfortable and enjoy working with numbers, strong proven analytical skills and a high competence in Excel & Power Point. You are persuasive and able to build good working relationships with stakeholders. You are able to get things organized and able to perform within a matrix organization. You will have excellent communications skills, comfortable networking with people, and able to influence.  A self-starter, you are able to work independently with a “can do” attitude. Bearing a flexible and open mindset, you are also a fast learner when it comes to new concepts. You should have three to four years of relevant working experience in a MNC and able to communicate effectively across the business with good business acumen and organizational awareness.

·         Strong analytical skills, and able to think out of the box
·         Excellent MS office skills, Excel & Power Point especially & knowledge on People Soft
·         Positive attitude with a keen interest and eye for details  

For further details please contact Windsor Low or send me your details to wl@elliottscotthr.com. Job Code WL/10876

Title: HR Operations Manager
CompanyName: Elliott Scott HR Recruitment Pte Ltd
Summary: Singapore, Insurance
Details:
One of the world’s largest insurance companies is looking for an experienced and mature individual to join their team in Singapore.

·         Leading international insurance company
·         Regional exposure
·         Dynamic, fast moving environment

Working as a HR manager, you will be reporting directly to the Senior HR manager supporting the Singapore and Hong Kong office. You will review policies and processes in relation to the employee life cycle, and leading the operational workflow in an effective and efficient fashion. You will ensure that payroll is being executed in a timely and accurate manner. You will be providing various HR reports and manage the recruitment operations. You will be managing the HR systems, and will work closely with the global team and improve the functionality of the system.

This is a great opportunity that will require an individual who has at least six years of dedicated HR experience. You will have excellent analytical and quantitative skills, strong in data management, office skills and presentations. You will work under minimal direction and with the ability to effectively coach and mentor. You are comfortable working with numbers and report writing. Additionally, you will have strong prioritization and good problem solving skills. We are also looking for the following:

·         Familiarity with employment laws and regulatory laws in Singapore
·         Good team player with great stakeholder management
·         Previous statistical experience preferred either in an in-house or a consulting environment.

Title: HR Manager
Summary: Our client is a well-known brand in the oil and gas industry with significant market share seeking a HR Manager for thier plants based in the West of Singapore
Details:
Our client is a well-known brand in the oil and gas industry with significant market share and an enviable reputation within their areas of specialisation. They pride themselves with unrivalled product knowledge, offering their clients the most comprehensive and best product portfolio in the industry. With a consistent revenue across the region, we are presently seeking a trusted HR Manager to partner with the Country HR Head and Country Head of HR in delivering excellent people agenda for the plants based in the West of Singapore.
 
Your principal responsibilities are to establish a strong working partnership with the business, in providing HR services and solutions to supporting business strategies. You will be responsible for HR operational excellence for the plant, by taking charge of daily operational matters as well as manpower planning and budgeting. Other responsibilities include:
  • Driving and managing trainees programs including working with respective government bodies, universities and institutions
  • Driving and supporting employee engagement programs including Global Employees Survey
  • Act as advisory to department heads on all HR related matters
  • Responsible for timely and accurate payroll management
  • Responsible for end-to-end recruitment activities including career talks and fairs, advertisement placement, selection etc.
  • Responsible for co-ordination and administration of performance management, annual review and retention program
  • Work closely with regional/home country HR on assignment administration and tax issues
  • Participate in HR-related surveys and market research and keeping abreast with market trends and policies
  • Responsible for data integrity of HR SAP and HR payroll systems
  • Preparation and timely submission of HR headcount and payroll reports
  • Review, implement and maintain up to date HR policies and procedures
  • Ensure all HR-related activities compliance with the local labour legislation
  • Establish effective relation management with union
  • Responsible for other ad hoc activities and projects
 
To succeed in this role, you will be required to have a Bachelor’s degree and be equipped with at least 8 years of relevant HR experience with a proven track record of being an effective HR Manager. You will require to have sound knowledge of relevant employment legislation, function knowledge in SAP and possess good communication and interpersonal skills.  
 
A transport allowance will be provided for this position. In return for your commitment, you will be rewarded with job satisfaction in a people-centred, results oriented engaging company culture.
 
Please submit your application with your full CV and include your motivation factors for your next career move. For any enquiries, please write to hr@dnassociates.com.sg quoting Reference No. 00144.
We thank you for your interest in this application and regret that only short-listed candidates are notified.

• Works closely with the business leaders to develop and deliver Human Resource strategies and programs that meets the business needs
• Facilitate strategic workforce planning to identify current and future competency needs for the business
• Lead the talent management process, including annual talent reviews and organization planning to accelerate leadership development at all levels in the organization

• review and implement compensation and reward programs to achieve department/product/business objectives

• Ability to execute tasks independently

Title: HR Manager
Summary: An organisation specializing in shipping and logistics
Details:
HR Manager
Location: Singapore
Report to: Head of HR

An organisation specializing in shipping and logistics is seeking a HR Business Partner to join their team. Job

Responsibilities:
• Work closely and provide consulting for the relevant specialist teams in the department on people initiatives
• Facilitate change management and ensure the effective implementation of people-related policies, methodologies and guidelines within the company
• Provide advice and consultation to business managers regarding all staff matters – including recruitment, performance management, staff engagement and communication
• Serve as a key contact for the business regarding HR policies, programs, practices and implementation at the line level as well as provide operational support and guidance to managers
• Monitor and maintain all departments’ compliance with local employment laws, regulations and applicable policies, values and behaviours, code of conduct, and work closely with HR and the business teams to ensure compliance and appropriate resolutions
• Highlight key organizational trends and issues through metrics, process analysis and other methods to determine potential human resources issues
• Provide forward-looking guidance, coaching and creative solutions to enhance individual and organizational performance

Key Requirements:
• Minimum 5 years of Human Resources experience, with at least 3 years of HR Partnering
• Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or equivalent
• Ability to develop high level of credibility and forge solid and positive professional relationships with all levels of the organization through the use of tact, diplomacy and discretion
• Able to multi-task, meet tight deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment to make things happen
• Demonstrate in-depth understanding of local employment laws, with solid analytical skills and strong ability to solve problems quickly and creatively

Title: HR Operations Manager
Summary: This Fortune 500 multinational, the HR team wears many hats supporting offices around the region and we are now seeking a multi-faceted HR Operations Manager /
Details:
Supporting the growth of an international company is no easy feat - it demands diplomacy, business acumen, and the ability to execute upon strategy that scales for a growing organization. At this Fortune 500 multinational, the HR team wears many hats supporting offices around the region and we are now seeking a multi-faceted HR Operations Manager to support the Singapore regional office.

This trusted HR Operations Manager is responsible for the planning, implementation and evaluating policies & procedures aimed at recruiting, compensating and developing people of appropriate quality and numbers to achieve the current and future business objectives of the company and the various business units located in Singapore.
 
The responsibilities include:
 
Human Resources Policies and Procedures
Ensure that fair, equitable and consistent treatment of all employees by planning, developing, recommending and implementing human resources policies, procedures and system. Ensure that HR policies, & procedures are adhered to.
 
Compliance with Legislation
Ensure that the company conforms to all relevant statutory requirements by maintaining awareness of existing and proposed legislation, determining its impact and making appropriate policy recommendations.
 
Staffing
Attract and recruit professional and competent employees in sufficient number to meet business objective by developing and promoting the image of the company within the target areas and by recommending and implementing appropriate strategies to meet planned manpower needs for current and future organizational requirements. Liaise with affiliates on matters in regards to international / inter - regional assignees.
 
Manpower & Succession Planning
Plan for the overall manpower requirements and succession to key supervisory and management positions by forecasting requirements consistent with corporate plans and by developing, implementing and monitoring specific plans to source manpower and fill key jobs.
 
Training and Development
Ensure the availability of required levels of staff, supervisory and management skills by identifying training and development needs and by planning, recommending training and development programmes consistent with organizational needs and business objectives.
 
Organisation Development
Plan, analyze and recommend organizational changes in line with the company's operating environment and business objectives so as to acquire new technologies, job design and organization structure.
  
 
Employee Relations
Maintain an effective and productive organizational climate by keeping aware of employee issues. Implement appropriate engagement program to promote employee relations.
  
Senior Management Participation
Contribute to the overall effectiveness of the company's business and corporate planning by participating in decision making with the management team and to provide relevant advice and recommendations to the management.
 
Remuneration Planning
Implement remuneration policies and practices which attract, retain and motivate employees by recommending remuneration levels which are internally equitable, externally competitive (pegged to company's ability to pay) and which promote high levels of individual performance.
 
Payroll Administration
Manage and direct the payroll administration in compliance with legal and company regulations. Ensure smooth and timely delivery of salary to employees on the specified pay day.
 
Office Administration
Oversees the office administration including office supplies, security and maintenance, tenancy of office space and procurement.
 
Others
Undertake Ad-hoc HR projects from time to time.
 
Requirements
  • Degree in Human Resource Management / Business Administration or related disciplines
  • 8 years or above solid HR experience of which minimum 5 years in the managerial level in a multinational
  • Well versed with Employment Act and related legislations in Singapore
  • Detailed minded, well organized, capable to prioritize and cope with multi-tasks
  • Ability to lead with strong organizational, analytical skills and good interpersonal skill
  • Ability and willing to develop subordinates

Working with a range of stakeholders, you will add genuine insight to the business and will develop a holistic understanding of the business, with many opportunities to demonstrate your talent and drive. You will find yourself working in a high energy, fast-paced and exciting environment. With a competitive salary and benefits package, you will benefit from a new and challenging position playing a crucial part in this company’s success story.
 
 
Please submit your application with your full CV and include your motivation factors for your next career move. For any enquiries, please write to hr@dnassociates.com.sg quoting Reference No. 00150.

We thank you for your interest in this application and regret that only short-listed candidates are notified.

Title: Senior Compensation & Benefits Manager
Summary: Based at the regional head office, we now have an opening for a Senior Compensation & Benefits Manager to join this winning team.
Details:
We represent a Fortune 500 company and a market leader known to provide global services and solutions that are delivered locally by experienced and professional teams. Based at the regional head office, we now have an opening for a Senior Compensation & Benefits Manager to join this winning team.  
 
Business Unit Responsibilities:
  • Build strong relationships with segment leadership and segment business units to understand business strategy and to plan and identify appropriate compensation solutions.
  • Understand top talent, key roles and strategic workforce plan to influence compensation strategy and planning with respect to base pay, incentives and equity
  • Consult on compensation and benefits issues globally to ensure market competiveness and adherence to budgetary guidelines
  • Partner with segment business units on the design and review of sales incentive plans and coordinate annual review of sales incentive plans to drive timely approval and roll-out.
  • Evaluate job content and formulate recommendations for band, level, title, pay based on analysis of duties, internal equity and market competitiveness
  • Coordinate compensation and benefits planning including administration of plans
  • Serve as compensation/benefits lead for acquisition due diligence and integration
  • Advise, train and provide data, analysis and tools on total rewards philosophy and programs to client group
  • Initiate and complete specialized analysis on competitive and internal compensation practices, strategies and metrics
  • Research, evaluate and understand the impact of market and economic trends and recommend adjustments to salary ranges, hiring rates, geographic differentials and individual rates, as requested
  • May prepare special studies and recommendations on subjects such as monetary recognition programs, incentive compensation, etc
  • Participate in salary surveys and recommend new surveys to ensure adequate job representation for a well-rounded survey library  
Asia/Pacific Regional Responsibilities:
  • Build market intelligence by selecting appropriate salary surveys from right providers; establish network of country/location contacts who can assist with process.
  • Conduct market pricing and job evaluation for local positions and in coordination with compensation operations.
  • Validate local market matching and ensure local surveys are provided to operations for inclusion in global database.
  • Review and calibrate job content and formulate recommendations for band, level, title, pay based on analysis of duties, internal equity and market competitiveness regionally.
  • Coordinate annual increase process, including process improvements to streamline process and shorten approval cycles
  • Support other M&A activities from due diligence to integration. Develop Rewards inventory by country;
  • In coordination with corporate compensation, support pay-for-performance philosophy by developing and providing the right tools to HR/management, e.g. performance based merit increase matrices, performance oriented promotion tools, etc.
  • Oversight of local variable pay plans including proposal of performance-based incentive plans, review and consolidation of participation and results in collaboration with corporate
  • Design local compensation/benefits programs or policies (e.g. car policy) in coordination with corporate
  • Help to ensure statutory compliance in coordination with local Country HR Management 
  • Assist in design, implementation and roll out of corporate programs
  • Establish external network/s with C&B Professionals from competitor companies to share best practice and obtain accurate market information outside of salary surveys
  • Initiate and complete specialized analysis on competitive and internal compensation/benefits practices, strategies and metrics 
Requirements
  • 10+ years demonstrated global compensation and benefits analysis, design, and administration experience required; Some consulting experience preferred;
  • Experience in Emerging Markets
  • Experience in Global/Regional Sales Incentive Plan design
  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration or Human Resources
  • Strong communication and consulting skills; Relationship builder with international skills and can do attitude
  • Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze statistical data and develop recommendations
  • Good understanding of equity including global use
  • SAP knowledge/experience preferred 

This position interacts with varying levels of personnel and you will have the ability to influence senior management on your decisions. Paired with a competitive salary and benefits package, you will benefit from a new and challenging position playing a crucial part in this company’s ongoing success, at the forefront of the industry.

Title: Senior HR Business Partner, APAC
Summary: Fantastic opportunity for an experienced HR professional to step into a newly created role
Details:
SENIOR HR BUSINESS PARTNER, APAC
 
Company Overview

This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced HR professional to step into a newly created role, leading the expansion of an IT firm in the region.

Scope of role

The role will encompass full-spectrum HR activities but will initially focus on the harmonisation process following the acquisition of a new team. You will also work closely with subsidiaries to assess the skill and knowledge needs and propose a collaborative learning plan. In addition, you will work closely with other leadership positions within Asia Pacific region to set the strategic direction and implement a gap analysis of current state and future needs.
 
The Successful Applicant
Ideally, you are a Degree qualified, with at least 10 years managing learning and development activities experience, gained in a multinational environment. You should be a sincere yet dynamic and flexible with highly developed interpersonal skills to build key relationships with internal and external stakeholders. You can expect in this appointment regional travel of around 30% of the time.
 
What’s On Offer
The successful candidate can expect a competitive remuneration package with comprehensive medical insurance, transportation allowance, flexible benefit and stock options and a great career opportunities in a well established multinational. The Company provides flexible working arrangement, casual and fun working environment.
 
Apply for this job

HEAD OF HR
RECRUIT, ENGAGE AND GROW TALENT

Title: HR Generalist
Summary: European Financial Services Firm
Details:
HR Generalist - Regional Exposure - Great Benefits & Career Progression

Respectable financial services firm headquarters in Europe now has a job opening for an HR generalist to handle HR matters in Singapore.

This role requires an adaptable individual with strong communication skills and the ability to work independently and intelligently.

Title: HR Business Partner
Summary: Our client is a renowned pharmaceutical player in the world is seeking a dedicated HR Business Partner.
Details:
Our client is a renowned pharmaceutical player in the world with a specialty range of products and treatment options to patients, physicians and healthcare providers worldwide. They pride themselves in continuous development and innovative products in the biopharmaceutical space and are presently seeking a seasoned HR Business Partner to join their regional office in Singapore. You will be responsible for providing support in the various human resource functions including employee relations, company employee communication and expatriate management. You will pride yourself in being involved in the development and execution of processes and metrics that support the achievement of the organization's business goals.

We are seeking a dedicated HR Business Partner align business objectives with employees and management with the designated business units. The HRBP will serve as a consultant to management on Human Resource related issues and act as employee champion and change agent. You will assess and anticipate HR-related needs, as well as communicate the business needs proactively. The HRBP will seek to develop integrated solutions with the team and the business. This formulated partnership will seek to deliver value-added services to the management and employees that reflect the business objectives of the organization. The HRBP maintains an effective level of business literacy about the business units financial position, its’ mid-range plans, culture and competition.
 
The HRBP will also have a dedicated interest in the following:
  • Conduct weekly meetings with respective business units.
  • Consult with line management providing HR guidance when appropriate.
  • Analyse trends and metrics in partnership with HR group to develop solutions, programs and policies.
  • Manage and resolve complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough and objective investigations.
  • Maintain in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Partner with legal department as needed/required.
  • Provide day-to-day performance management guidance to line management (coaching, counselling, career development, disciplinary actions).
  • Work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, increase productivity and retention.
  • Provide HR Policy guidance and interpretation.
  • Assist employees with expatriate assignments and related HR matters.
  • Provide guidance and input on business unit restructures, workforce planning, succession planning.
  • Identify training needs for business units and individual executive coaching needs.
  • Participate in evaluation and monitoring of success of training programs. Follow-up to ensure training objectives are met.

To be successful in this role, you will possess the following experience, knowledge and skills:
  • Minimum of 7 - 10 years of the resolution of complex employee relation issues.
  • Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines including compensation practices, organizational diagnosis, employee and union relations, diversity, performance management, federal and state respective employment laws.
  • Relevant experience from the pharmaceutical industry is a plus.
  • Excellent client management and business literacy skills.
  • Strong conflict management skills.
  • Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Develop strong trusting relationships in order to gain support and achieve results.
  • Effectively envision, develop, and implement new strategies to address competitive, complex business issues.
  • Work in environment with international objectives.
  • Be flexible and available to interact with employees at all levels.
  • Be self-directed and motivated.
  • Take initiative to identify and anticipate client needs and make recommendations for implementation.
 
Our client has a strong focus on core values, encouraging innovation and a positive attitude to the opportunities afforded by change as port of a growing organisation. You will be assessed on your skills in providing organisational development consulting, performance management, leadership/executive coaching and other generalist human resource creative solutions to senior management team as well as your ability to drive HR strategies. In turn, you will be part of a team that values open communication and is supportive of each other.
 
 
Please submit your application with your full CV and include your motivation factors for your next career move. For any enquiries, please write to hr@dnassociates.com.sg quoting Reference No. 00161.

We thank you for your interest in this application and regret that only short-listed candidates are notified.

Title: Talent Acquisition ï¿½ UK Financial Services
Summary: Looking for Strong Recruitment Partners who enjoy being hands on and value-adding as part of a team. Broad role covering both lateral and campus recruitment!
Details:
Summary

Our client is a Reputable UK-based Financial Services firm, with strong presence both globally and in Asia and are well positioned for continued growth in the region. They are currently looking to build a team of strong in-house recruiters to bring in the right talent for the business.

Responsibilities

Reporting into the Talent Acquisition Head, you will be responsible for managing recruitment for your business groups across all levels. With a focus on direct sourcing, you will be working closely with business stakeholders, identifying suitable sourcing channels, managing the process through to on-boarding. In addition, you will also be responsible for building up campus recruitment. This is a greenfield project, where you will be involved from establishing campus relations, employer branding activities, selection & assessments. This is an exciting role where you can take ownership and value add to the organization.

Requirements

You should be degree qualified, with at least 4 - 8 years experience in HR, with an emphasis on recruitment. You should have proven ability to be hands on and deliver talent acquisition services in a fast-paced environment, and able to engage stakeholders at all levels. Strong communication skills are required to work effectively across the business functions and levels.  Above all you must be highly motivated, professional and have a customer focused and matured approach.

Interested Applicants

Kindly submit your application online using the Profile Search & Selection website, which can be accessed via the “Apply Now” link below.

Please search for this position under our Human Resource practice area, the Job Reference Number is AS13252.

We will treat your interest in this role with the strictest of confidence.

Title: Head of HR - Based in Philippines
Summary: World class Pharmaceutical organization with an established successful track record worldwide
Details:
• Strategic and decision-making role
  • Attractive remuneration package

About Our Client
Our client is a world class organization with an established successful track record worldwide. A pioneer in their field, with an excellent team of senior management and a forward-thinking culture, they are investing heavily in the ASEAN region and are looking to recruit a high caliber Head of HR based in Philippines.

Job Description
You will be responsible to implement the HR strategy, policy and procedures of the organisation in Philippines. The organisation is constantly developing, growing and changing so the role requires you to operate with autonomy, flexibility, resilience, independence and competence. You must balance the encouragement of creativity with the need for policy and procedure, and must be able to quickly establish effective working relationships with all levels of management and staff. You will be responsible for the full range of employee life cycle activities (recruitment, induction, onboarding, performance management, exits); HR activities (policy, process, implementation) and stakeholder/customer relationships. You will also own, drive, design and deliver HR projects impacting managers, employees or stakeholders.

The Successful Applicant
Ideally you should be degree qualified and have a minimum of 7 to 10 years experience in a renowned MNC in a business partnering role. Strong foundation of compensation practices, legislations and trends is highly advantageous. You are a proven leader, an effective communicator and possess strong influencing skills. You are highly confident with exposure to senior management. Due to interaction with China counterparts, you should be effectively bilingual in English and Mandarin.

What's On Offer
Working with a range of stakeholders, you will add genuine insight to the business and will develop a holistic understanding of the business, with many opportunities to demonstrate your talent and drive. You will find yourself working in a high energy, fast-paced and exciting environment. In return for this challenging brief, you will find your job satisfaction in their people-centred, engaging company culture.

Title: HR BP, SEA, with OD, Change & Talent Management - Design Technology
CompanyName: Elliott Scott HR Recruitment Pte Ltd
Summary: Singapore, Design Technology
Details:
HR BP, SEA – with OD, Change & Talent Management - Design Technology
Singapore Based
Central
 
Amazing mid-senior level opportunity for first rate strategic HR Business Partner to join an engineering and hi-tech design company headquartered in Europe. 
  • Standalone/SEA Remit – Singapore, Malaysia
  • Visionary  Company  in Growth 
  • Career Move Opportunity – global possibilities
Reporting directly into the Regional Head of HR based overseas, and working locally with the SEA Team, first and foremost your role will be to shape and drive the people agenda and transformation across Singapore and Malaysia across a large population of around 1000 employees (and growing). As a senior HR practitioner you will be a trusted partner working directly with c-suite leaders offering coaching counsel and advice with maturity and wisdom to instil their confidence and trust. The other main aspects of this role include Talent Management, Leadership Development, OD and Reward – and as such will be adept in taking the lead on the highly competitive arena of benefits and incentives.
 
This already established company is continuing to grow fast and is undergoing constant change and restructure to ensure the best HR policies, systems and plans are in place. It’s also a matrix and complex company with centres of excellence, and as such you’ll be someone already well used to operating in this environment to support you to deliver the strategy.
 
The opportunity would suit someone who is looking to join a truly visionary company and with a strategic remit; this is not an administrative/transactional HRM role. Ideally you will have worked with Ex Pat Leaders and within a global company or MNC within engineering or technology.
  • Strategic HR Business Partnering
  • Leadership and Executive Coaching – of western ex pats
  • Organisation Design; Strategic & Operational Change Management
Commitment to people and high standards of integrity is essential as is strong HR reporting ability. This is an amazing opportunity to get involved with and be part of a forward-thinking and high performing company set for continued success across the world.
 
To apply, call Zofia Sharman today on +65 6632 3629, and or send your CV to zs@elliottscotthr.com. Job code ZS/10908

Title: Assistant Director - OD, Employer Branding, Talent Management
Summary: Drive change and implement the employer branding for this growing Social Media business
Details:
A unique opportunity has arisen for an Assistant Director to join this growing Media organisation that focus on online companies. A European MNC, it currently operates across the SEA region and looking to expand into further markets. 

As the business has grown, the HR function requires a professional to look at the group level organisational development, employer branding, talent acquisition and development in particular, in alignment to the organisation's strategic direction and business strategy.

Reporting to the CEO and working as an individual contributor, you will be looking at the employee option surveys and rolling out initiatives based on the results, but going heavily into employer branding as there are currently 35 businesses within the group which need to be harmonised and OD will play a key role in cultural change. 

The successful candidate will be a qualified professional with more than 10 years relevant experience, with strong OD, employer branding, employee engagement, and talent management. If you think you have the right experience for the role, please send your CV (Word format) to Ash Russell (ID R1109296) ash.russell@hays.com.sg  or call +65 63030721.

Title: HRIS Manager
CompanyName: Elliott Scott HR Recruitment Pte Ltd
Summary: Malaysia, Consumer goods
Details:
Excellent opportunity for a seasoned HRIS Manager to join a world class American consumer & commercial products company. With an excellent global presence and rich history within the industry, this multinational is now looking for two resilient and independent candidates to join their team.

·         Foreign MNC
·         Working within a friendly regional environment
·         Global role

As a HRIS Manager, you will report to the HRIS Director who is based in US and working with a global headcount, you will have vast experience in project management particularly with SuccessFactors. You will be responsible for the migration of systems from Oracle to SuccessFactors, and rolling it out for the APAC region. You will have experience with Talent Management implementation on a global level and ensured collaboration of Success Factors globally. Similarly, you will have a deep knowledge on SAP with a solid experience on HCM. You will partner with various HR process owners to develop strategies, objectives and roadmaps for the HRIS application and you will manage project plans, budgets and status reporting. You will participate in system testing prior to implementation, upgrades and enhancements, while providing reliable support to the end-users.

We require senior level candidates who have strong proven experience managing and implementing HRIS systems on a global basis. You have a solid understanding of HR processes and how they impact HR systems and at the same time, you will have a solid foundation of HRIS design, structure, and functions. You possess a drive for results with a strong process orientation, strong influential skills, as well as an ability to work in a collaborative environment. You are exceptionally strong in data management, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent communications and presentation skills are essential and while having good listening skills, you are adaptable and open to new approaches and feedback. In addition we are also looking for:

·         HRIS / HR / Technology background with minimum five years experience
·         Experience with large scale systems implementations (i.e SAP HCM, SuccessFactors) 
·         Degree in HR, Information Systems or direct business experience
·         Must be fluent in Mandarin because it deals with clients in China

For further details please contact Windsor Low or send your CV to wl@elliottscotthr.com

Summary: An excellent opportunity with a US MNC in the Oil & Gas industry
Details:
• Industry leader
  • Oil & Gas MNC
About Our Client
Our client is a US MNC in the Oil and Gas field with recent acquisition of an Asian business. The role will report directly to the CEO and set-up the HR department.

Job Description

  • Policy development and deployment, working directly with the CEO to build and maintain HR practices for the organization;advisory interface with department heads on people-related matters such as hiring, learning & development, retention and engagement.
  • Act as a business partner, change agent, and member of the HR team
  • Support the senior management team in driving company-wide programs, initiatives and core HR programs (e.g. Compensation Planning, Calibration, Performance Management Cycle, Succession Planning, Leadership Development, etc.)
  • Lead recruitment and selection process in partnership with the business to introduce solid candidate pipeline for vacancies
  • Manage external partners on HR & office-related matters such as payroll & benefits administration, training providers etc to ensure the delivery of quality services
  • Actively participate and engage in the process for the continuous improvement of departmental procedures

 The Successful Applicant

  • Minimum 8 years of HR experience with a degree in HR or related discipline
  • Team player, able to interact with people easily
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills both written and oral
  • Keen understanding of the business operations and the relevant departments / functions
  • Driven, resourceful and able to articulate and advance ideas for improvement
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
What's On Offer
Work Life balance, flexible working hours, attractive package and fast growing organization able you to develop very quickly.

Title: Human Resources Manager, South East Asia
Summary: US industrial multinational company, Strategic and hands-on role, Make a difference today
Details:
A key leader in a niche industry, our client has extensive global presence and now seeks an experienced Human Resources Manager to lead its People agenda for South East Asia Region.
 
As strategic partner to each of the assigned countries in the region, you will align HR strategies with business strategy and provide high level professional and operational HR advice to business leaders.  You will develop HR plan on people management to improve performance and organisational capability, lead and implement best practices in HR management, and guide the team in providing excellent HR support to the business.
 
You are degree qualified with minimum 8 years of hands-on HR generalist experience, preferably in MNC known for HR best practices.  You have proven success in HR operation in a leadership role, executing change management activities in a complex matrix reporting environment.  You possess strong influencing and partnering experience with cross-cultural business leaders, ability to work with all levels of staff and a strong passion in building a performance-driven culture.  Strong commitment to quality, standards of service excellence, and values such as integrity, collaboration and respect are key success factors.  Those who are willing to travel frequently to the region and open to relocation will be preferred.
 
Interested candidates, please forward resumes in MS Word Format to hr@talent2.com.sg quoting reference MH/JD46117/SL.  Alternatively, you can contact Maureen Ho in our Singapore Office, at +65 6511 8555 for a confidential discussion.

The areas of focus will include but not limited to Talent Acquisition, Organisation development and Learning and Compensation and Benefits Management. A people manager, you act as a coach and mentor to beef up the HR capabilities of your team members.

The HR Manager is the first point of contact for assigned business unit leaders and employees, to provide advice, coaching and support on HR fundamentals and employee related questions.
This role is critical in creating an employee experience which attracts and retains top talent, executing our location/region specific initiatives, providing available and responsive internal customer support, and driving HR functional excellence and process improvement.
The HR Manager is responsible for providing dedicated support and guidance to multiple managers and employees in the business with specific focus on HR fundamentals. This encompasses:

  • Provide employees and managers with an available first point of contact for questions and guidance on fundamental HR topics and issues.
  • Employee advocacy/engagement, HR policy/procedure training, employee relations management, performance management, recruitment, compensation, and workplace investigations
  • Coordinate local compliance initiatives.
  • Partner with HR Operations as appropriate to address manager and employee inquires.
  • Analyse and interpret data as required in order to support HR strategy in core functional areas (retention, recruitment, compliance, diversity, etc).
  • Ensure that routine and complex employee relations issues are properly identified, reported, investigated & resolved.
  • Provide advice and counsel to managers and employees to ensure consistent application and integration of policies, procedures and practices at 100% compliance to promote an ethical and compliant work environment.
  • Lead key HR processes including compensation planning and compliance.
  • Conduct HR training and support for functional processes like salary planning and new employee orientation
  • Conduct investigations including gathering, preserving, documenting and analysing all available information and evidence, and in some circumstances, making recommendations to the business on disciplinary action
  • Partner with business leaders and HRBP professionals to execute business-specific HR strategies/initiatives as needed
  • Maintain and protect confidential data with utmost scrutiny, judgment, and care
  • Lead other regional/country HR projects as necessary, working across multiple client groups
 
Requirements
  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university or college
  • Minimum of 5 years professional work experience with at least 3 in the Human Resources function
  • Enthusiastic team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment
  • Approachable and responsive resource able to connect with employees at all levels
  • Comfortable with high volume workload and able to manage multiple priorities
  • Not afraid to "roll up your sleeves" and get involved in details
  • Strong internal and external customer service focus, with a genuine desire to assist others
  • Strong project management and complex problem-solving skills
  • Strong presentation skills and facilitation experience, needed to effectively deliver a variety of HR-related training programs to groups of managers/colleagues
  • Ability to interface at all levels of the organization
  • Passion for innovative HR solutions and process improvement
  • Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Detail-oriented (especially with regard to effectively managing and documenting employee relations issues and investigations)
 
This position interacts with varying levels of personnel and you will have the ability to influence senior management on your decisions. Aside from a competitive salary package and professional development with this HR market leader, you will be rewarded with a steep learning curve and be part of an equal opportunity employer committed to serving a diverse workforce.
 
For a confidential consideration, please submit your resume in word document to Cherry Wu at hr@dnassociates.com.sg, quoting reference number 166. We thank you for your interest in this position and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted
