Title: HR Consultant (Talent Management)
Summary: Great opportunity to join a dynamic team in a reputable Consultancy
Details:
• Great Culture and Dynamic environment
  • Attractive Salary Package


About Our Client
Our client is a prestigious and renowned US Management Consultancy and a leader in the sector that they operate in. They are one of the world's largest consulting firm, with offices in over 35 countries and with more than 15,000 employees worldwide. As part of its ongoing commitment to expand the business in Asia, they are now looking to recruit a high-caliber experienced Consultant for their Talent and Communication team. The successful candidate can look forward to a rewarding career with an organisation that prides itself on its strong work culture and open communication across all its employees.

Job Description
Reporting to the Director for Talent and Communication, you will be required to think strategically in partnering with clients to form unique approaches to align their organization challenges with your creative solutions ensuring that it is in line with their business objectives. You should have the mental agility to solve problems and to connect with people from diverse cultures. Key to your success will be your ability to work at an enterprise-wide capacity to assist with the consultation efforts at a strategic level to accelerate change, reduce risk and to win the buy-in of the organization's employees.

The Successful Applicant
Ideally, you are a Degree qualified individual from a reputable University with at least 2- 4 years of experience in a HR consulting or a HR Practitioner in the Talent Management or Performance Management Field. You should be a culturally sensitive and mature individual and have demonstrated a strong track record in the projects that you had previously undertaken. You should be dynamic and enjoy working in an innovative and creative setting where you will work on challenging and stimulating projects with a team of like minded individuals across different continents. To be highly successful in this role, you should possess excellent business acumen and negotiation skills to lead, influence and engage with Clients and Stake holders.

What's On Offer
The opportunity to join one of the world's most dynamic companies and a leader in their field of work. A strong culture of developing their consulting professions with comprehensive training from technical skills to professional skills development. You will have the opportunity to work on a wide spectrum of work across different industries providing you with an unsurpassed platform to further build your career and skillsets.

• Newly created opportunity

About Our Client
Our client is a market leader in the consumer goods market. The company has a sizeable employee population in APAC, over 2,500, including the Regional Heads of Business and the APAC HQ. This role will cover Asia Pacific and will manage a direct team of five, based in Singapore. This is a new role created in line with a new global organisational strategy, which will aim to bring multiple businesses in the group together into one new organisation.

Job Description
Reporting to the Global Head of HR, this role will involve team management, as well as being a Business Partner to the country business heads and the APAC President. There are six direct reports to this role and indirect influence over all HR practitioners in APAC. The key focus will be on Talent Management and advising the business on human capital decisions for APAC. Career opportunities beyond Singapore are a reality, and the APAC business is growing fast. This is a hugely challenging role, and will need someone who understands the importance of dealing with multiple cultures and perspectives, whilst being able to drive key initiatives in an ever changing and growing environment. The successful candidate will have great stakeholder management skills to partner with the business heads and key executives of the leadership team, where gaining trust and profiling HR are imperative. This role will be based in Singapore on local terms and will have low travel.

The Successful Applicant
You should be based in Singapore or APAC due to the complexity of multiple cultures and have an in-depth understanding of the sub region. Industry experience is not essential; although it is vital the new hire has had previous team management responsibility. As this is also a commercial organisation (rather than manufacturing) in APAC, a good understanding of similar businesses would be valuable. The HR team in this organisation has always impressed us, as this company takes HR seriously, and the business leaders want to invest time in Talent Development.

What's On Offer
Working with a range of stakeholders, you will add genuine insight to the business and will develop a holistic understanding of the business, with many opportunities to demonstrate your talent and drive. You will find yourself working in a high energy, fast-paced and exciting environment. In return for this challenging brief, you will find your job satisfaction in their people-centred, engaging company culture.

Title: Regional Training Manager
Summary: Drive new and enhanced training programs to increase sales productivity and efficiency
Details:
A very successful global high-tech firm is looking for a Regional Training Manager for their Sales Productivity and Training team. This position will be responsible for identifying and driving new or enhanced processes, tools, applications, and training programs that increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the company’s global employees.

The Regional Training Manager will create and implement training programs with a focus on ensuring sales, services and marketing personnel across both the company and partner organizations are effectively trained to meet and exceed their assigned job responsibilities.  This includes providing skills & product trainings to effectively bring new employees onboard, while maintaining appropriate skills and performance that develops and expands the expertise of the learner.

As a subject matter expert, you will work with regional stakeholders & cross-functional contributors to design & deliver training programs & curriculum to support the business’s objectives in driving growth through increased productivity.  You will be responsible for administering, organizing and conducting training and educational programs associated with company’s products and services within Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ). 

You will be managing a team of training specialists & coordinators to deliver a variety of training content at the field level, inclusive of selling methodologies, processes, systems, products and industry knowledge.  Major programs you will be managing are annual regional/global training events, new hire onboarding, functional role based programs & professional career development. You will also develop means for  measuring the effectiveness of training programs through testing, feedback assessments, personal observation through remote monitoring and side-by-side shadowing of training attendees, evaluation of results reporting for training attendees and meeting with their direct managers on a scheduled basis.

The successful candidate must have individual sales experience together with a proven track record in training in a sales environment at a high technology company. With high energy and drive, you must demonstrate a dynamics sales personality and able to work independently to excel in this role.

If you think you have the right skills and background, please contact Vargin Yeke at vyeke@mcgregor-boyall.com or call him on +65 6394 7064 for more information

In line with its' continual business growth strategy, the organisation is presently seeking a HR Shared Services Lead to join their established HR team.

Working with key stakeholders, your team is responsible for payroll & benefit administration, expatriate management, policies, audit & compliances, training administration, maintenance of HRIS system records, employee engagement survey roll-out, performance management system, salary review and bonus administration and manpower budget preparation. You will also be working closely with Business Partners and Centres of Expertise to understand and fully support HR policy, procedures and new projects.

To be successful in this role, you will possess a continuous improvement mind-set to actively seek opportunities to improve and develop a service and customer oriented environment. The requirements are:

  • Experience of managing third party providers efficiently and effectively
  • Previous experience of working within a professional HR shared services model and a good understanding of HR policies and procedures is a prerequisite
  • Good hands-on knowledge in payroll processing
  • Experience in HR transformation work
 
You will be working in an established & global organisation in a role that encourages creative thinking and the ability to drive strategies. My client is a truly employee-centric organization and offer an attractive remuneration package with a range of excellent benefits.

Title: HR Business Partner
Summary: Our client is presently seeking a HR Business Partner with a secondary portfolio in Compensation & Benefits to join their established HR team.
Details:
Our client is a Fortune 500 multinational who works in partnership with a broad spectrum of institutions, governments and commercial organizations in the hospitality, energy, healthcare, industrial market. They offer exceptional standards of equipment and service solutions in water and energy resources. In line with its' continual business growth strategy, the organisation is presently seeking a HR Business Partner with a secondary portfolio in Compensation & Benefits to join their established HR team.

We are seeking a dedicated HR Business Partner to align business objectives with employees and management. The HRBP will serve as a consultant to management on Human Resource related issues and act as employee champion and change agent. You will assess and anticipate HR-related needs, as well as communicate the business needs proactively. The senior HRBP will seek to develop integrated solutions with the team and the business. This formulated partnership will seek to deliver value-added services to the management and employees that reflect the business objectives of the organization.
 
In a secondary portfolio, you will also be the champion for Compensation & Benefits strategies, acting as a consultant to the COE team and business to build a detailed understanding of the C&B environment in line with business objectives.
 
To succeed in this role, you will be required to have a Bachelor’s degree, delivered in the capacity of a HR Business Partner and be equipped with a minimum of 5 years specialist experience in Compensation and Benefits within a multinational environment.

This role requires strong cross-team collaboration, executive presence and organizational agility. It must drive coordination and accountability to key stakeholders across the broader business structure.

This role places you in a position of influence where you will have direct access to business units and feel the pulse of the organisation. Engaging deeply with the line, you will facilitate line discussions by providing HR perspectives and sound guidance on people challenges. You will proactively share HR intelligence and insights with the objective of inculcating a talent mindset, promoting a high performance culture and building a healthy succession pipe. You will also shape and drive organisation-wide HR initiatives in the areas employee engagement through understanding motivations, and establishing strategies and platforms to foster organisational commitment, as part of the overall employee value proposition.
 
For a confidential consideration, please submit your resume in word document to Cherry Wu at hr@dnassociates.com.sg, quoting reference number 183. We thank you for your interest in this position and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: HR Business Partner
Summary: With its Regional Headquarters located in Singapore, the company is currently seeking to employ a talented HR Business Partner.
Details:
From its roots in established markets, our client brings efficiency to some of the globe’s most challenging environments, offering unmatched personal service, a global footprint and customised capabilities in developed countries and emerging economies alike. A publicly traded company, it is one of the world’s leading providers of integrated logistics, delivering a strong Q2 profit for the first half of the year driven by increased volume coupled with operation efficiencies.
With its Regional Headquarters located in Singapore, the company is currently seeking to employ a talented HR Business Partner to drive the continued success of its business and that of its customers.
 
We are seeking a dedicated HR Business Partner align business objectives with employees and management. The HRBP will serve as a consultant to management on Human Resource related issues and act as employee champion and change agent. You will assess and anticipate HR-related needs, as well as communicate the business needs proactively by developing integrated solutions with the team and the business. This formulated partnership will seek to deliver value-added services to the management and employees that reflect the business objectives of the organization. The HRBP maintains an effective level of business literacy about the business units financial position, its’ mid-range plans, culture and competition.
 
The HRBP will also have a dedicated interest in working as a strategic partner to enhance performance through appropriate advice and delivery of best-practice service to internal clients.
Your key responsibilities will include proactive relationship management and providing HR advisory and support in all aspects including recruitment, employee relations, performance management, talent management, reward, guidance on HR policies and mergers & acquisitions. You will assess the organisation’s needs for training and development programs and develop solutions to address the current and future needs.
 
To be successful in this role, you will possess the following experience, knowledge and skills:
  • Minimum of 8 - 10 years working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines including compensation practices, organizational diagnosis and performance management
  • Excellent client management and business literacy skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Develop strong trusting relationships in order to gain support and achieve results.
  • Ability to understand issues domestically and regionally and communicate effectively with clients.
  • Be flexible and available to interact with employees at all levels.
  • Be self-directed and motivated.
  • Take initiative to identify and anticipate client needs and make recommendations for implementation.
 
Working with a range of stakeholders, you will add genuine insight to the business and will develop a holistic understanding of the business, with many opportunities to demonstrate your talent and drive. You will find yourself working in a high energy, fast-paced and exciting environment. With a competitive salary and benefits package, you will benefit from a new and challenging position playing a crucial part in this company’s success story.
 
For a confidential consideration, please submit your resume in word document to Cherry Wu at hr@dnassociates.com.sg, quoting reference number 190. We thank you for your interest in this position and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Summary: Newly created role in leading and fast-growing organization
Details:
• Strong career growth opportunities
  • Extremely well recognized and stable brand name


About Our Client

We are representing one of the largest leaders in the Singapore markets. Committed to delivering the best class experience in all aspects of their business, they are currently looking for a talented and driven SAP Payroll Manager to lead the team in Singapore.

Job Description

Leading a small team, you will own all payroll procedures including analysis, design & implementation of payroll processes and implement changes leading to best practice operations in accordance with the company policies. You will be responsible for the full-spectrum of payroll related matters and you will oversee the processing of the in-house SAP payroll system as well as support the team liaising with payroll contractors and other third party providers. Managing the monthly payroll process from the start to finish for a large number of employees, you will be responsible of payroll reconciliations, monthly report calculations, oversee annual pay reviews in preparation of bonus and merit calculations. As the Payroll Manager, you will be working closely with the in-house accounting team, hence you should have a good understanding of accounting-related processes. Ultimately, you will guarantee continuous improvement of Payroll processes and strategies to align with overall business objectives working cross-functionally with supervisors, managers, and other stakeholders.

The Successful Applicant

You should be a degree qualified HR professional, with at least 5 years of experience using SAP payroll systems in a team leading position. Ideally, you have strong accounting knowledge, as you will be liaising with the in-house accounting team on a weekly basis. You are results-driven, hands-on and confident to advise managers on payroll matters. To be highly successful in this role, you must have the ability to manage large amounts of data and adapt extremely quickly to change.

What's On Offer

This is an excellent opportunity to grow in a well-established organization and to have a direct impact on the business.
